description:
Great for a quick bite or happy hour. Came here a lot back in law school when I had no choice but to be in the Tenderloin for lunch. I certainly wouldn't travel from a better part of the city for this place, but I recommend it if you're in the area. The wait staff is very friendly (unless you're trying to just come in for a free meal...) and speaks both mandarin and Spanish. I was very impressed. 

If you're here to drink, they have a full bar and some fun specialty cocktails. I would usually just order old fashioneds so I couldn't say how their cocktails are. 

Their menu features standard Thai food, with the veritable assortment of Pad Thai dishes, which all the ones I have tried were fairly good. 

Good place for a quick and satisfying bite in the area.
author: Robert M.

description:
The duck soup with egg noodles heals my soul. 

It's an unassuming restaurant with some great dishes and some misses. I've found the chicken dishes to be inconsistent but the duck, beef and tofu are usually spot on. 

I'm not a Thai food aficionado but the soup is consistent and yummy. 

That is all.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
Food is always consistently ok, nothing that impresses me. No dish stands out where I'm like oooo ahhhh I will come back, not here. If you're looking for a quick lunch, come here. They are quick and customer service is always good, just wish the food can get better too. 

I would def pick the lunch special over their soup. I got the Tom Yum seafood noodle soup today. I rarely not like Tom yum and this place just about to push me over the edge! They messed up my favorite
author: Kris J.

description: Good service, good food, fun decor. While it's not in the best area, the interior could be a trendy restaurant in any other neighborhood. My pad Thai was a great texture, and even the bean sprouts tasted fresh. I'll definitely be back.
author: Alice Z.

description:
The closest Thai restaurant to my current work place and a regular go to place for my co-workers. 

Got one of their lunch special (Fried fish in red curry sauce served with rice), it was decent. Got a little salad and an egg roll on the side with the order. It was good and I would come back for it.

On the other side, two other orders from our table by my friends was turned down as they did not have the thin noodles. It was a little disappointing and they had to choose something else.

On my way out I saw that they offer a bunch of drinks and appetizers for $4.99 which sounded good. Will come back to give it a try.
author: Keerthi C.

description:
Place was empty around 1130. Not a good sign... 
I had checked yelp & their website ahead of time for their menu. Website lunch menu is a broken link. Yelp menu is severely outdated. 

I was excited to try the tom kha I saw online but when I got there it wasnt on their actual menu. I special ordered it anyway and requested pumpkin instead of meat. And a side of brown rice. I also saw roti on their yelp menu but they also didnt have it in reality. Super sad day. 

First they served me a noodledish. Looked like pad Thai.. I told them I didnt order noodles. 

They brought me my soup. Omg it was soo sour. Couldn't even taste the coconut. Idk what they did. Pour a cup of fish sauce in there ?? And only came with 4 small squares of pumpkin. So sad. I came here cuz my manager was treating our team out to lunch so I felt bad and told them it was yummy and finished my soup...
The one good thing is their brown rice. It was really good and healthy, had some black rice mixed in it too. 

I wouldn't come here again by choice,but all my coworkers liked their food, so looks like we'll be back ...
author: Angela C.

description: After a long day of seeing the sites, my husband and I were looking for a place to grab some dinner by the BART station. There were not many choices besides Lalita and though my husband is wary of spicy food, we decided to give it a try. He had the crispy chicken on fried rice and I had the Pad Thai and we were both very pleased with our delicious meals. Everything was fresh and flavorful and the staff was friendly and helpful. We were very glad we are here!
author: Christine F.

description: I just love love love this place. Full menu in the bar with a great happy hour. And the best bartender ever!  So friendly!
author: Daniel A.

description:
Wow how could a place like this even survive in a city like SF?! 

With unlimited dining opportunities in the city, the food here was just not acceptable. It's hard to believe they serve this kind of food here. I was brought here by coworkers due to the proximity to work but boy did this restaurant suck. 

We all ordered lunch specials. I got basil chicken. My dish came with a small side salad and two egg rolls. The highlight of my meal was deff the egg rolls. They were well made, crispy, and pretty tasty. The basil chicken was another story. I could not taste the basil at all and the chicken was yucky! I didn't wanna waste food so I actually almost finished my plate. One of my colleagues ordered the same dish and I noticed she had at least 2/3 of the food left. 

Again it was quite astonishing a place like this exists. Lalita! You either get it together or call it quits so you can save some expensive SF rent money!
author: Angela F. W.

description: Not particularly outstanding in the flavor department, but the food is dependably prepared, and the service is great, friendly without being cloying. The reasonably priced full bar is actually a big attraction and has some regulars that stop in after work for refreshment.
author: Donny N.

description: Slow, very rude service; They do not want to answer your questions--just take your money I've had better tie food in North Idaho. I'm gonna just say this place is an overpriced dive, with bland food on the outskirts of the tenderloin and one can only imagine how filthy the kitchen is. If you want overpriced and not very tasty Thai food, this might be the spot for you. As for me I will never go into this establishment again, The only thing "exotic" about this restaurant is the price you pay for so little food
author: Brian C.

description:
Came here for a quick bite to eat prior to the theatre.  Happy hour snacks we chose were: shrimp rolls; short beef ribs and French fries.  All were excellent - loved the shrimp rolls best and the French fries were just awesome. A lot to choose from for snacks.

Great customer service, good atmosphere and clean toilets. 

2 beers and 2 glasses of wine plus the food was around $30.

We will definitely be back!
author: Laura R.

description:
For Valentine's Day this year, a friend and I decided to meet in the city and find a place to dine.  Walking in the Civic Center area, we stumbled on this place and decided to try it out. 

I can honestly say I don't get it. It's a restaurant but nighttime shows neon lights, turn exotic looking bar? It's spacious, I'll give them that, and the wait staff is super fast. They just don't really talk. 

For dinner, we had the following: 
-Crispy chicken with three-flavored sauce for $13.95. Breaded chicken served with bell peppers, tomatoes, pineapples and onions topped with sweet and sour sauce. I'm sorry, what's the "three flavored"? It's soggy chicken in sweet and sour sauce. That's it. Not a fan.

-Pad See Ew with chicken for $10.95. Chicken with fresh flat rice noodles, eggs and Chinese broccoli. A little better than the last dish. At least the flavors were there. The chicken was little too dry but with the flavors, I can somewhat overlook that. 

-Panang curry with beef for $12.95. Beef with bell peppers, basil and coconut milk. This was the best out of the three. It was served with white rice and the panang was flavorful. 

Overall, not the best experience. I've certainly had better Thai food. I wish I had a better experience but unfortunately, just didn't make a good enough excuse to return. Maybe in the future, you never know.
author: Rockne H.

description:
So ... I could write a thorough long winded review, but it's much easier if I just endorse all of the 1 and 2-star reviews already written.  I similarly question how this place remains in business. Living nearby, I rarely see people in the dining area of the restaurant/bar. 

I suspect the FBI or DEA is surveilling the joint as there is no way they are surviving on the merits of their food alone.
author: Justin D.

description: Stumbled upon this gem after work one evening with a friend and we will definitely be back. Service is friendly and the food was delicious.
author: Kelly B.

description: False advertising. Portions are a bit small and prices are really high. They gave horrible service. A lot of choice but the quality is definitely not what we expected!
author: Corbin L.

description:
I am pretty serious about my food lol so I don't believe that my review being very different from some of those that I've read is a happenstance. This place was GOOD! 

My aunt (who is a semi-regular) and I ordered the mushroom and string bean chicken dish. Sweet gawd it was fresh and it tasted amazing. The drinks were good too. I ordered a peach daiquiri. I didn't walk about with a mid-day buzz like I had hoped but it tasted good and there was a little liquor in there lol. My aunt said "she felt great" from her drink Mai Tai.

I was on vacation that week and the following week and all I could think about was which day I would be catching Bart to Lalita's for a repeat of the lunch I'd had.

I wouldn't call it "Exotic Thai Cuisine" It feels very Cheers bar like. Not a negative but important to point out for anyone who hasn't been and may get confused by the name. I haven't looked at the photos, they may very well depict this.
author: Keya S.

description: Food was good. We had the honey grilled pork and egg rolls. It's not in the best location in town but it was close enough to the theaters and my friend recommended it.
author: Carmen M.

description: Great after work spot for happy hour..drinks and eats in the $4 range. Nice and clean spot that serves a yummy lunch. Good service, very friendly staff.  The bar wraparound is crazy long. Try this spot for lunch or after work...it's nice and Safe
author: Rodney I.

description:
I went here for lunch yesterday with a group of work-out buddies to bid farewell to our gym instructor.  I ordered the sweet and sour chicken with salad, rice, and an egg roll.  I liked that the sweet and sour sauce had a bit of a kick.  The fried chicken was crispy but still tender.  My favorite still is the egg roll.  For $12, it's a good deal.

We got our food pretty fast, and service was overall friendly.  I don't know why the restaurant is dark, but considering the heat wave SF has been having, I didn't mind.
author: Vira P.

description: Wow.. the service has significantly improved in the last 6 months. The food is is absolutely great! The lunch menu is worth the price!
author: Zeke M.

description:
This place is hands down the shittiest place I have been to in a long time. The service was terrible. The server couldn't have appeared more unhappy to be there if you paid her to act as-if. The food was overpriced and almost cold. The beer we ordered was not the beer we received and they poured it short. Very short. Biggest tip: DO NOT ORDER THE BROCCOLI BEEF. 

Save your tastebuds, time and money and go pretty much anywhere else.
author: Crystal M.

description:
Quiz of the day: Which of these is the WORST?

1) "house" wine for happy hour - Asked the waitress. Had no idea what it was. Had to ask 3x. Still no idea. THe customer next to me answered FOR her (i guess she was a wine expert)

2) french fries - soggy and raw on the inside

3) only server taking multiple SHOTS with customers at 5 PM

4) when i told the server the fries were raw & soggy, ... guess what she does.. YEAP, without asking the customers, picks one up, breaks it w/her BARE hands, smells it.. and puts it down on the plate
author: TaeWoo K.

description: HAIR IN MY PAD THAI EW LISTEN TO YELP'S safety scores or you will learn like I did  I felt like eating noodles for lunch and yelped a few Thai places in the area. When I clicked on Lalita, there was a notification that popped up about the poor food safety of the restaurant. I chose to ignore the notification and go ahead and try the place out anyways. It looked like a decent place when I arrived, with many tables and a bar. I had called ahead on the phone to make my order and when I reached I waited about 5 minutes for my food. I get back to my office, open the box and am about to dig in when I see a nasty black hair in my noodles! Sooo grossss. On top of that the noodles were cooked unevenly, the tofu was not good, and half of the box consisted of random veggies. Not a classic Pad Thai, and 100% not worth the price. You get better quality pad thai at lower rated places for cheaper without hair... Never coming back again and would advise anyone who enjoys food not to try this place.
author: Saachi G.

description: Came here before a play and first time food was not terrible or service we had a good size and it was quiet . I am just really bothered by the koi fish pond I went to check it out before I left and the pond is only 3 foot by 4 foot at the most with at least 20 koi fish some of them are so big they can't even move around they just sit there . I am going to call animal services and see if there is anything they can do . But for now make sure to mention it to them when you go . You know that's messed up .  Thanks .
author: Jessica W.

description: Below average chicken pad Thai. The noodles were either undercooked or not fresh. The chicken was bland. The tofu was hard and tasted a bit sour. Would not try again.
author: James L.

description: Didn't have any food, but the drinks we got were so yummy! They used fresh squeezed ginger in the Moscow mules and they were delicious! The bartenders were also very friendly. There weren't very many people there so the service was fast. Not sure about the quality of the food because we didn't get any, but great place to grab an awesome Moscow mule!
author: Delaney B.

description: This is close to where I work or otherwise I wouldn't have known that it was here! Excellent Thai food and a great staff. I have 2 favorites which are Pad Thai with prawns and the salmon salad. Both are excellent, it just depends on my mood! The only bummer here is their location as if you get a seat by the window, you are staring at the neighborhood bums who are staring at you. If you ignore them they don't go away. Just ask for a seat away from the window and you'll be fine!
author: Sandra P.

description:
Even though this is pretty close to my home, I've never been all that tempted to come here. It probably has something to do with its edge-of-Tenderloin location and the fact that I never hear anything about it. Nada. But I finally tried it a couple of weeks ago and didn't think it was too bad. It's quite a cavernous place dominated by a big bar as soon as you enter. There appears to be a regular crowd that assembles here since everyone looked pretty settled on their stools chatting up the bartender.

I was taken to the empty room next door where for a while, I was the only diner in the place. Slow night, I guess. As the weather was brisk outside that evening, I went for the $10.50 Roast Duck Egg Noodle Soup, which indeed was a good-size bowl of warm broth with plenty of roast duck, bean sprouts, cilantro, scallions, and spinach leaves (see photo). It was pretty good although there was a tad too much garlic oil since a slick surface developed that made the soup appear less than fresh.

I decided to order a side of the $5.50 Steamed Mixed Vegetables, which is exactly what it was, dominated by a whole lot of cabbage (see photo). I ate my dinner rather mouse-like in the large dining area while the bar was abuzz with drunken revelry as if I was invited to the prom only to be left on a folding chair in the gym next to the shoes. As I was looking above my head to see if there was a bucket of pig's blood ready to be spilled on me, a couple finally came in to eat. OK, now it's a party.

FOOD - 3 stars...decent enough duck noodle soup
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...strangely large and quiet in the dining room, but the bar is hopping
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...she came by periodically
TOTAL - 3 stars...a Tenderloin trap?...not really
author: Ed U.

description:
"Sometimes you have to take a dump in your boss's office to get $hit off your chest."  -Dice K. circa 2004

So my buddy Dice is stoic by trade but definitely no Seneca or Marcus Aurelius. However, he treats this place as his own Roman bath house, despite court orders to adhere to the no shirt, no shoes, no service axiom.  He always says something profound that I wish someone scribed on an olive leaf, napkin, chalupa, or not at all.  

A little fact about DK, he is a LA Dodger fan by birth. I once tricked him into watching a Colt's game where he had $150 on old Payton covering the spread, however, he was too jonesed by the action to know that he was in the midst of the Giants clinching the series in 2010.  To this day, he still cries about confronting a Civic Center exodus of orange and black.  The tears are saltier on even years.

We like to think of this place as the watering hole for future insurance claims adjusters that are investing in a law education up the street.  In short, above average happy hour prices, with average appetizer options.  

Mondays are magically delicious because Ray Ray tends the bar and keeps the hobos from freeloading bathroom privileges without patronizing.  Ray Ray is a Saints and A's fan but still retains the hand eye coordination to pour generous Jami's on rocks.

This place is definitely a great respite from the TL piss uphill and the pretentious VC vibe across Market Street.  It sits on an intersection that will make any non union, civil engineer cringe.  In fact, the turns in front require Google buses from gentrifying the TL, via vehicular manslaughter, instead of their usual cultural-slaughter?!.  Lalita Exotic Thai, has been there before the dot, dot, dot com experiment, and likely will survive when Twitter has to answer to shareholders, and move jobs to Austin.
author: Sam T.

description: Beware of this place! We ordered the pad see ew and the beef tasted bad so we sent it back. The restaurant manager refused to take it back and replace it with anotherr dish. I have been eating out for decades and have NEVER had a restaurant refuse to take a bad dish back. Shame on this restaurant! This is very bad business practice.
author: Patti I.

description:
Lalita Thai is located on McAllister right off Market St. and the UN Plaza.  Getting out from the BART station, you might encounter some characters enroute to the restaurant. 

The restaurant was fairly busy, but our group had no problems with seating.  After checking out the menu, we placed our orders.  All of us ordered from their $11.95 lunch specials featuring 10 different choices. 

Grilled Honey Pork - The pork was sliced into strips and included egg roll, jasmine rice and a mixed green salad. You can substitute brown rice for a $1 more.  The pork was tasty, but felt the portion was small and that it would have tasted better had it not been lukewarm. The provide a cup of Coconut Tapioca Pudding for dessert. 

Overall, the food at Lolita is ok compared to some other Thai restaurants a couple blocks away in Little Saigon.
author: Al L.

description: Once a week I cover the office for my client.  Besides the food truck in front of Union Plaza, I like to find actual restaurants in the surrounding area to eat at.  Its not the best neighborhood per say to walk around for too long but its good enough.  Besides Philz Coffee, the Golden Era Vegetarian place, and the occasional  market place in the Twitter building; I've thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant.  The pricing is fair and so are the portion size.  The flavoring of the food is great.  The only down side is the service level might not be up to par when they have a huge lunch rush.  Just try to be patience, the food comes out fairly quickly.
author: Angela V.

description:
Taste is okay.
Needs work. A lot of work.
Lasting impression is so-so.
author: Gilbey G.

description: Nice spot for lunch. They were quick and the peanut sauce was a good choice.  I would go back for sure. I'm sure I will.
author: Scot M.

description: First time here and the wait staff is amazing. The food is well cooked and comes pretty fast. The food is amazingly good. Very nice restaurant in a not so good area, definitely a diamond in the rough!
author: Tino C.

description:
The food was awesome.
The service was amazing.
The food prices are reasonable. 
The food portions are good.
"Drinks" are eh pricey.
author: Pj A.

description:
Cheap? Yes. But seriously, happy hour here turned out to be more like hassle hour. When you find yourself chasing servers to order food + drinks, the so-called "cheap eats" experience is just not worth it. 

Lalita Thai is close to the Orpheum Theater, which is why we stopped in for some happy hour bites pre-show. However, I can't say I'll be back. My business is going elsewhere next time around...

Oh, and the food? Forgettable. In a city with amazing Thai options, this was beyond mediocre.
author: Mansi A.

description:
A well deserved five star rating for Winnie, the portion size, the excellent quality of food and cheap pricing for their happy hours.

I am always so happy, filled, and hopeful for returning back.

Tip: come on an empty stomach! Lalita's won't let you down!
author: Ryan K.

description:
I've never really thought much of Thai food because I was afraid of its heavy seasoning and would often order the safe foods like pad Thai or Thai tea. But I ended up liking everything I ordered! I don't remember the names but I tried their duck curry and stir fry fish and broccoli and they were amazing! The flavors weren't too strong and the curry was probably one of the best Thai curry I've had! Their Thai tea isn't too bad either. 

Service was really great (coming at a non-peak hour might have helped). Overall, I definitely would recommend this place for anyone who's new to Thai food or looking for a great date place!
author: DIana L.

description: The very first time I visited this restaurant was when I used to work at FiDi and met up friends to have lunch. I didn't realize that this would be the same restaurant near my work now near civic center almost 5 years later! I'm glad that they are nearby, because I love Thai food! I frequent this place almost every week that I think they know me by now because I order almost the same thing, Rib eye steak and rice! Most other Thai places don't serve this dish. It comes with a sauce that I love dipping the steak in! I have tried their other Thai dishes. The food is not memorable but it's good! The service is friendly especially when they get to know you because then you just sit down and they ask if you want your usual. LOL! They can get busy at lunch time (12ish pm), so thank goodness for an hour lunch break!
author: Yma Richel N.

description:
This is a Thai restaurant crossed with a sports bar. Came here with my younger brothers to watch the NBA final.

The servers here are really sweet and accommodating.  We only got the appetizers:  delicious grilled calamari and "Thai onion rings".

Came back to try some Tom Kha coconut soup on a windy night when I suffered a slight cold.

Tom Kha with chicken: 4.5 stars
Comes with heaps of tomatoes, onions, and chicken, and the soup is the perfect blend of  tangy, sweet, savoury, milky and smooth. I added my own glass noodles at home to make this a hearty meal.
author: Letitia L.

description: Our favorite Thai place for a pre-theater dinner. We return over and over again. Try it - you won't be disappointed.
author: Harald L.

description:
Delicious! Lunch special is a steal! So much food! I had the spicy crispy fish with red curry and it was the best I've had in a long time. Curry was supposed to be "thai spicy" but I found it mild at best.

Rice comes in a heart shape :)

Complimentary rice pudding dessert was very lite and not too sweet. 

Great service too! Ambiance is a bit dated but still endearing. Central location (civic center Bart/muni).
author: Semuteh F.

description: Sorry. I got the info for the restaurant from Dripadvizer. I was in a hurry, trying to work backwards to Orpheum theater from food before show. My girlfriend and I each ordered 2 fancy drinks that cost $11 a pop, which was about standard there. Unfortunately no trace of alcohol. My girl ordered a shrimp salad $13, which in hind site I should have ordered. I ordered the "Boneless Duck with Steamed Vegetables" $18 with brown rice. Got the plate, had salad, not steamed vegetables... tasted the duck. It was stone cold. Called the server back, she said it doesn't come with steamed veg but we'll give you some, and she would address the cold meat as well. Waited 10 min or so, another young lady brought the plate back, it had salad, steamed vegs, half the amount of meat which looked like it had been deep fried but alas was still cold. So my girl and I feeling pressed for time went ahead and ate the food. While eating we asked the server if we could talk to the manager. She pointed to the opposite end of the building and said, oh she's over there. About ready to lose it after that stupid response, I asked her to go get the manager and send her over. the manager came over and was flabbergasted that I thought there was a problem. After pressing the situation she said she'd take part of the bill off. We had an $80 bill and she took $3 off. I'd say along with the warning popup from the HEALTH DEPT about this place that showed when I started this review, I've got a legitimate Bitch about this Crappy joint. DON'T GO THERE!!!
author: Chuck D.

description: I came here on a visit to San Francisco from NC, as a great Thai food lover, I decided this would be a good place to have dinner. We came in and sat ourselves at the bar because NO ONE greeted us at the door. After sitting there for about 10 MINUTES one of the waitresses/bartender asked us if we wanted anything to drink. She came back and we order a Pad Thai, 2 MINUTES later it was delivered to us. I know that Pad Thai does not take 2 minutes to make. When I tried it, i realized that the noodles were HARD TO CHEW ON. There were proteins we DID NOT ask for. And it took me waving her down from her wonders to come and give us our bill. We were never asked if we needed anything or if it was good. She definitely has her frequent customers as she called them by name but did not bother on the new ones. I have a feeling the food we ate were recycled, or had been sitting on that plate all day. I OPENED MY YELP ACCOUNT TO WRITE THIS REVIEW. Defiantly, DO NOT RECOMMEND.
author: Erika M.

description: I went in for the first time and needed to use the restroom before I ordered and they demanded me to pay before I could use restroom.  I said I'm waiting for friends and they would not let me use restroom unless I gave my credit card.  I can not believe this happened.  We were going to be a party of 4 trying the place out for the first time and guess what now - NEVER AGAIN
author: Brad L.

description:
I've passed this place by hundreds of time on my way to work and never once looked at it as I whizzed by on 7th street. It's definitely worth taking a look if you're downtown and you're tired of Osha or King of Thai. We were there for a birthday dinner for 4 people and unfortunately it was also the night of the Pacheo/Margarito fight. 

Thank goodness the staff was so forgiving and understood half the men at the table were going to be occupied at the bar. We literally sat at a long table for almost an hour before getting everyone together to order entrees. My advice for those who have dinner companions who are running late is to order one of their fabulous cocktails 'cause it definitely packs a punch and keeps you mellow. 

I ordered the spicy eggplant with chicken and they did not disappoint. The eggplant was seared and tender with a delicate coating of spicy sauce and chili. It was so good I didn't even touch the rice I also ordered with and it wasn't even because they brought me the wrong kind. I love a place that gives you a great balance of vegetables and meat instead of letting one overpower the other. 

For dessert, they brought over ice cream and fried banana covered in chocolate along with tapioca pudding. If you've had fried banana once, you can pass on it here but I thought it was sweet that they added trick candles and sang to all four birthday girls. This restaurant is most definitely a hidden little gem in downtown and with the easy parking, could be an excellent alternative to Osha and King of Thai on a popping Saturday night.
author: Jessica K.

description:
I'd probably give them 3.5 stars... 

Like the other fellow Yelpers... it's really close to the Orpheum so its about convenience ... and my friend said it's popular for Happy Hour folks that works around the area... since when we got there, it was packed with Happy Hour folks.

Anyway, my friend and I ordered the following (family style):

- Corn Fritters = first time I've seen that in a menu so we had to get it. I think my excitement got the best of me since it was just a batter with corn, deep fried. Oil oozing ... lovely. It was ok, not really mind blowing and since I know what it is... check.

- Lemon Grass with Beef = it was just sauteed veggies with beef. It was ok, I assumed that it was going to be grilled since other places have lemon grass beef... but nope. I ate it since I needed protein, it was decent taste but again, nothing too extravagant.

- Stir Fried String Beans and Crispy Tofu in Plik King Sauce (friend ordered this)... and since it looked spicy, I didn't dare touch it. Friend said it tasted ok, not too spicy.

- Pineapple Fried Rice = like my obsession with chocolate chip ice cream, I'm in the hunt for who has the best Pineapple Fried Rice (so far, I think Osha is winning my poll!) Anyway, this was eh... not enough pineapple and it was dry... not moist enough. It had a lot of onions but not enough chicken/shrimp and all the other goodies. 

- Sticky Rice with Mango = this was awesome ~ probably the highlight of the night! The presentation was cute and the sticky rice was just the right sweetness to compliment the mango. 

- Thai Iced Coffee (me only) = it was strong! Just what I needed to last me for Wicked.

Overall, I was tempted to try their happy hour cocktail menu but I'm off alcohol for now ... so next time. 

Ambiance: ok but it has that sexy groove that they want to achieve through their menus. 

Service: prompt and fast and friendly.

If your watching a show at the Orpheum... I'd definitely recommend it. Price for the two of us plus tip: ~$60
author: Cath M.

description: You wouldn't think much about this place since it's in the tenderloin, having work literally a minute away I had to try it out and I am impressed!  Good food and I love the cute atmosphere inside.
author: Katie N.

description:
SWEET SWEET SWEET SWEET.  And NOT in a good way.  What happened to this restaurant?  I used to come here all the time and the food was never like this.

The calamari salad and fried lotus/tofu/yams were fine but everything else tasted like they had a cup of sugar thrown on top.  

I was introduced to Tom Kha (coconut soup) here years ago and it's been one of my favorite soups - I couldn't even eat a few spoons it was so sweet.  Ended up fishing up the shrimp and mushrooms and leaving the soup completely.  It wasn't even remotely spicy nor did it have any flavor other than SWEET.

The fried whole fish was also a disappointment mainly because of the sauce which was like something off of Panda Express.  Few years ago they had green beans, deep fried basil...now they have some sweet and sour sauce with bell peppers.  Again WAY too sweet.  Sauce did not compliment the fish at all -  it overpowered it.

I'd expect food of this caliber from an all you can eat Asian buffet.
author: Crystal G.

description: Went in for a bite to eat before the play across the street. The restaurant wasn't so crowded on Friday night at 6:30, most people were at the bar or drinking. We sat down, ordered and the food came out pretty fast, so that was a relief. I liked one dish out of 3 we ordered, the shrimp, green beans and fried mushrooms. The other 2 dishes were kind of bland.
author: Yoko S.

description:
This place is better off as a bar than a restaurant, not because the food is bad, because it's okay, but because of the regulars I saw during my dinner that were hovering around the bar before I arrived, and after I left.

The food is decent, but like all SF thai places, you're paying $12 for a pad see ew you can get for $7-9 elsewhere. I'm not sure I'd go out of my way to try more of the dishes here, but I certainly can see this place being reliable for a quick bite to eat before catching a show at Bill Graham or the Orpheum theatre.
author: Zoe H.

description: For lunch this place is great. The food is consistently good and comes out quickly. The environment is noisy and happy. The health score is a little low for me, though I have never seen anything to give me pause.
author: Morris R.

description:
Today - service was terrible. I understand there's a lunch rush, but it was not that busy that it takes 40+ mins to get food. We had a group of 5, each of them got their plate at different times. about 10mins apart. I on the other hand, didn't even get my dish out. We ordered 2 Pad Thai Noodles and one came out and the other didn't Finally after 40mins of waiting I decided to cancel my order. 

After I cancelled, no apologies were made or asked if there was anything they can do. Worst service I've had to experience this year.
author: Mo R.

description:
so I've been on this ramen kick lately,
but today I was really wanting 
some flat egg noddles
(dose anyone else think
that they're kinda like linguine?).

my first choice would have been
Hai Ky Mi Gia,
and for those who know,
you know how good their
thick egg noodles are.

but since it was raining,
and the fact that Hai is closed today,
I opted for Lalita.

I gotta say,
after sprinkling a little chili powder,
for that requisite heat,
their # 12 with flat egg noddles
really satisfied.

Beside a good amount of noodles,
you get some won ton,
some bbq pork, and some greens.

The dish is super balanced
and is particularly good
on a rainy day like today.
author: Dan B.

description: Don't order a drink here. Bartenders have no formal training and break all of the basic rules. Last night I watched the woman behind the bar use a glass to scoop ice. Great work if you like shards of broken glass in your cocktail. I also love standing at the bar for 5 minutes to get my change.
author: Brandon H.

description:
I love this place's deals plus the food is always delicious.

This afternoon while having lunch with a friend, however, there was a huge cockroach walking around on the wall next to us towards the back. Ew.

I'll probably still go back for happy hour... we'll see.
author: Tara S.

description:
I was going to give it three stars because although service was slow and the food was expensive and I asked for no bean sprouts in my pad thai and there were bean sprouts in my pad thai, the food was tasty...until I got home and found out that the waitress did not pack all the leftovers from my grilled duck dish.  She left out the steamed vegetables, which for $14 for the dish, I think she should have packed.

Not going back again.
author: C L.

description: I don't understand this place. I get it, they have a busy happy hour. Drinks are cheap, appetizers are cheap.The service is not only incredibly slow, it's like they go out of their way to ignore you.
author: Monica S.

description:
If it looks too good to be true, it likely is. Right? That's what they say? That suits this trip for me quite well. A slightly different route home yesterday from BART and I stumbled onto this place. Whaa? I missed a Thai place in my hood? I must be slippin.

To the left is a full bar when you walk in, badass.  A Thai place where you can eat AND get your drink on? Looking good so far... $3.50 draft beers and well drink happy hour? Getting warmer...

A jungle style mural on the wall, high ceilings, nice lighting, random statues. I'm getting the vibe of a nice place to head after work with pals. Lots of seating, drinks, polite staff, nice ambiance. It's adding up, I'm feeling good.

But it alllllways comes down to the food, right? I order the green curry with tofu and veggies to go. "Make it medium spicy, leaning towards hot please". No prob says the man with the plan, he then relays my order to the bartender to key it into the computer. "Um home boy, you didn't mention the medium/hot spicy situation..." Oh, he forgot. Within 45 seconds. He assures me he'll walk back and let the cook know. 

I down a happy hour cocktail while I wait, still feeling good. I get my food bagged up and off to the pad I go.

The ONE positive: the portion was large, lots of food in that there container. Too bad it was COMPLETELY BLAND. Not spicy in the least, no real flavor, soupy and watered down . The veggies were all different than what he told me. I wouldn't have cared if it tasted good though, too bad I only get huge portions of suck food.

So boring, so lame. High hopes, dashed via a huge bowl of boring ass curry.
author: Justin N.

description: They serve very authentic Thai food and at a very decent price. We got a curry,  a ginger chicken and a pad thai.  They were all delicious and they don't skim on portion.  We had to take the food to go since they gave us so much.
author: sonya h.

description: I've come here for a few work happy hours. This place is good for that, drinks prices and food are okay.
author: Josie C.

description: I love their lunch specials! Large portion for only $11! Plus, all the staff are really friendly. Oh! And they also give you free dessert after your meal =)
author: Nicole D.

description: I was here years ago so I don't know if they are still open or under the same ownership / management, but the food was phenomenal. Maybe the best Thia place in San Francisco, right up there with Muang Thai (which is now closed). And the bar and drinks were great too. I love the ambiance, and that's a lot coming from me because I usually prefer dirty and dingy places because they usually focus on the food and do a better job, rather than charging for the presentation and having lousy or sub-par food. But this place managed to do both and very authentic as well. Now, the beautiful environment inside was a striking contrast to the creatures lingering outside in the dicey civic tenderloin district. But it's worth the dangerous trek! I remember the Crispy Basil Chicken being out of this world! This place is a San Francisco MUST!
author: Peter K.

description:
Here for Game 6 of the World Series. Much anger. Such yelling. Very sad. 

Good for game days. Lots of room and lots of TVs.

Okay for every other day. The food is pretty overpriced for what it is and the service is sub-par, but the environment isn't bad considering the surrounding neighborhood.

Apparently the beers on game day are $3.50. My friend was adamant I make that known.

If you're in the area and want a sit-down place with okay Thai, check it out.
author: Yanni L.

description:
I usually only get the Pad-See-Yoo, which is solid.  Everything else is pretty meh.  A little disappointing, especially considering you can get amazing Thai food on Larkin not too far away.

But apparently they have a great happy hour.
author: Max P.

description:
This place is legit.

Solid happy hour menu with a very well designed bar area that plays half way decent music. Could use a little more diversity with their draft selection but hey, I'll take it.

Then my friend and I came here for a sit down dinner and that was impressive as well. Waiter made a good call on a recommended spicy dish which turned out very well. The curry chicken had a nice, flavorful kick and went perfect with some rice and a diet coke. My friend had a combo fried rice which was also very good and hooked up in quantity. 

Can't really find a worthy complaint for Lalita, good job staff.
author: Patrick O.

description:
This place is located not far from my apt and being a usual fan of pineapple fried riced, I had ordered this a couple times to mediocre satisfaction.  

Last night, I switched things up and ordered the rainbow curry with chicken with a side of brown rice--holy moly!!  The flavors were simply perfect.  Spicy, sweet and savory all at the same time.  I honestly feel it's a big expensive, but will definitely order again.
author: Joshua G.

description:
I work around the corner and have had several business lunches here.  We really like the food, and the atmosphere is pleasant.  Services is generally good, but not especially friendly.
We met for a surprise birthday party last night, bringing 30 people to the bar/restaurant.  It took a very long time to order drinks, and I think we overwhelmed them with this many people at 6:00. The waitress brought my appetizers, but did not bring napkins or forks to the table. I reached to the table behind me to pick up the cloth napkin, and the waitress snatched it out if my hand. She said the cloth napkins were for dinner, and because I was here during Happy Hour I would have to use paper napkins. It cost a dollar each for a cloth napkin. Seriously??
I am very disappointed in Lalita. We brought over $1500 to the bar last night, and I don't think they appreciated the business.  We will still go there for an occasional lunch, but I won't suggest it for an after work party again.
author: Shelley E.

description: I was looking for a place, on Valentine's day, near the Bart and near the Great American Music Hall for the ZZ Ward concert that night, and hey, this one popped up. I was afraid being in the Tenderloin it might not be so great, but it honestly wasn't too bad. Not overly crowded, decor was nice, and they even took my reservation (even though it wasn't really necessary to have one). My friend and I were running late (damn Valentine's Day traffic getting into the city), but our other friend got there first and ordered for us. Our food only took about 10 minutes to come out. Duck curry was pretty good, pad thai was standard, and papaya salad - nothing special. Thai iced tea was a bit sweet, but all in all, a decent meal.
author: Veronica C.

description: The food was okay, but the decor was a little weird. Seemed like it was trying to be a nightclub? Service was okay, but took a long time to flag someone down for the bill. Neighborhood is rough. Wouldn't necessarily go after dark..
author: Alison Y.

description:
I was near Civic Center today and has a craving for Thai Food. This place satisfied my craving. Although, I have have better Thai Food else where. My friend told me this place was pretty expensive, but it actually was not that expensive. I had beef with peanut sauce served with rice and some vegetables for a little over $10.

The service was pretty good too, given that we had a large party. Although, their menu states that there is a limit of two credit cards per table, they were more than willing to give each of us a separate check!
author: Kevin K.

description: Like their pineapple fried rice. They seem to cook that different but the taste is very balanced. Broken rice well stirred withe curry spice, right touch of salt, coconut oil not overshadowing the others and you can feel the sizzle when presented. Everyone think they can cook fried rice, but rarely you find someone doing it right.
author: Morris N.

description: What a wonderful spot. The ambiance is great and I love the design. Now, their food...wow..I had the Pad see ew and a Chai ice tea...wow..soo good. A must go :)
author: Debra A.

description:
Oh boy. Everyone seems to come here to drink booze. Too bad I can't have any on my lunch break.

The lunch deals are worth it. They are generally $8-9 depending on what you get. I like the lunch combos where you can pick what meat or veggie + tofu, then pick a sauce.  It comes with rice. Brown rice is an additional $1.

I had the veggie tofu pad see ew and it looked SOOOO BLAND but it packed a lot of kick. Tasted like a lot of white pepper was in it.. which can be a good or bad thing. Rad Nar seemed a bit bland/ Lots of gravy though.

Portion size is just perfect though. Had me full without over-eating.
author: Susy C.

description:
My friends and I were looking for a quick bite and something close to our hotel (Renoir Hotel), so I was happy to find this Thai restaurant literally across the street from us.

The ambiance was nice and I felt welcomed when we entered. We were seated and given ample time to look over the menu. I ordered the Pad Thai & my other friends got the curry and the ribeye. Everything was hot and tasted great. We had Thai food a few nights before (although we had a lot to drink that night and dont remember it all too well). I liked how my Pad Thai was good, but not greasy like other places Ive been too. The price was very reasonable and I would definitely recommend dining here.
author: Lucky U.

description: Giving this place one star is generous. The service is AWFUL and the restaurant is dirty.  The food is sub par on a good day. Prices are absurd given the poor quality.  The only reason this place is still in business issue to lack of options in the tenderloin. Go to House of Thai instead.
author: Taylor P.

description:
The one star is because I have to and to be honest the staff was very helpful and nice, but the food was just about the worst I have ever eaten at a restaurant.  The chicken was boiled and thrown in some ginger sauce (and not good sauce), the meat had no flavor and was rubbery.  My friends was the same with a little pepper added as what the menu calls pepper chicken.  The spring rolls were just about the worst I have had and then to top the insult there was a $70.00 bill.  
Do yourself a favor and give this place a miss.  Tried it out because it was close to the theater....what a mistake.
You know I must not be the only one...my friend and I did not eat anything from our plates and the waitress did not even ask why... Scary.
author: Nancy B.

description: Went in after Giants game. Every time I got a drink they charged me a diff price for it, One time it was $7, $8 $11 $12 for the same drink.  Older guy and young bar tenders are cool. The other ones are a bit shady and try to over charge. Keep your receipts....  They did the same thing with the food. The Menu said one price but the bill was a higher price.  Food was good at least.  But I won't be coming back.  Way better places around.
author: Stephanie B.

description: Total surprise. I've seen this place from the outside many times and didn't realize it's really neat inside. I had a twisted Thai Tea. Who doesn't want vodka in their thai iced tea really? Oh yeah, the food was great too. I'll be back.
author: Mark S.

description: I did not like the server, she was really rude, dismissive and slow. I had couple of questions about their dishes on the menu, she did not seem to know much and did not care to give me an answer. I had to ask for a manager. The food was actually pretty good, but service sucked. I talked to the manager again after the dinner, hopefully they will have a discussion with this server.
author: Jeff M.

description: Def! Not a recommendation! Food was bland, meat was uncooked and had a strange smell! I think it was old. I live around the neighbourhood and wanted to visit. It now made sense why the restaurant was always empty.
author: SpawnPukar J.

description: if i could give this racist place no stars i would. as a black man dating an asain woman from another country  and taking her out ti have a good experience i would not recommend this place to any black people dating out of your race. you will not be welcomed.  even my date was asking if this place was racist smh. i mean waiting for a waitress was like waiting for 2017 to come. and then when we did i get helped after like trying  to flag them down multiple times i the bad energy and customer service was horrible.  i work right down the street from this place and i would never go back there. not only the service was bad but the food was bad also. they did  not provide a good comfortable pleasant well mannered service. and i will continue to date my asain girl friend no matter what people think in this society fuck them and fuck this place .
author: Ron M.

description:
The food here isn't that great but for the Tenderloin and the prices, they get an A for Effort. The waitress messed up my friend's order giving him chicken instead of the shrimp he ordered. When he called them over to make sure they didn't charge him the extra $2-3 for shrimp, they didn't apologize and just said they would be charging him the chicken price. 
Their Long Island Ice Tea is good and they have a huge selection of other drinks. It does get super rowdy and packed with a very eclectic mix of neighborhood/court and state employees during happy hour though.   It's a fight for the seats then, but if you come during the off hours, you'll be fine.
author: Patricia S.

description:
3 stars for the food and an extra star for their extensive selection of cocktails and ambiance.

Appetizer- "angel wings"- I don't know what authentic thai food taste like, but I assure you, the "angel wings" are BULLSHIT. For god sake, they don't even give you WINGS. The $8 appetizer came with two stuffed drumsticks. Funniest thing of it all, the drumsticks were stuffed with noodles. Maybe they shouldn't have called them "angel wings" to trick me. When I order them from other places, I get actual WINGS with NO noodles. I wanted my Americanized angel wings..........

Roasted Duck (with a side of rice) was succulent. The skin was crispy and full of fat. MmmmHmmmm! The portion was bigger than I expected. (The "angel wings" killed all my hope) I guess this place is pretty pricy for thai food. $14 (including rice)
author: emily g.

description:
So working in the area, you have to try every thai place in the area. Its cheap and fast.  I wouldnt say its the best thai place in the area, but it isnt the worse.

If you eat in, they give you a soup to start along with your order. I got the Pad kee mao and it was about average, my friend had the minced chicken basil,,, a bit salty, but the thai ice tea was good.

I'd come back again since I am poor
author: B H.

description:
The happy hour here is good. I will be back for it. As far as lunch, it was disappointing. I get the feeling that this place is more of a Thai Beer Bar than a Thai restaurant? 
Because happy hour is jumping in this place. 

I went to lunch and the place was a ghost town- like no one here. Whats worse is the Pad Thai had zero taste. Like no seasoning or flavor at all. Then all three of the people working didn't come by. I needed some chili sauce, but just ate and then left. The place is super clean. I will be back for their very good happy hour if I am in the area..
author: Jim B.

description:
Do you work in the area?  Do you care more about enjoying a cheap strong drink and less about ambiance?  If so, you should make your way to this Thai fusion place.  Their happy hour prices are awesome for San Francisco.  The ambiance not so much (lighting is incredibly dim going on dark - kind of depressing).  That said, the lady behind the counter is incredibly sweet and she makes the drinks strong.  And, you really can't beat the price!

They have food on their happy hour menu -- I've only tried their Thai fries.  What's a Thai fry?  That's what I asked too -  they're potatoes just like any old fry but unlike your typical ones these are in need of seasoning and taste kind of undercooked.  I ate mine with a lot chili sauce on the side (made it a little more enjoyable). 

Their regular menu has typical Thai food offerings - and if you like burning the taste buds off your tongue, they'll help you - as in, they will not hold back at all if you tell them you want your dish spicy.  I ordered my papaya salad extra spicy (which in general was not very good) but it was incredibly spicy (which was amazing). 

It's one of those places that's convenient if you are in the area and aren't expecting something special.  If you want something nicer in terms of ambiance and are willing to pay for it, you'll probably want to skip Lalita.
author: Kimya P.

description: If it was possible I would give less than one star. Negative stars actually. Went there after graduating last night from a school right by there and stopped by for drinks on way to hotel. The bartender Winnie first said only shots then turned around and took drink orders from others. Then she charged $13 for a shot of Jameson and a ginger ale back that wasn't Jameson even Jameson. We watched her use the soda gun and spray coke then give it to us like we didn't just see her. When she tried to give to us she even nudged her friend like she was happy with her self. Then when we told her we saw her she tried to deny it. On top of that we got charged $80 for 6 drinks.  6 drinks which some included beer. Outrageous. I will never go back. Horrible service. Can't believe someone would be that dirty.
author: Myrhissa B.

description:
This place is great! I went with a large group of friends and sat in the back with the comfortable chairs and benches. They let us play music and just have a great time hanging out and having fun. Everyone here was super friendly, and the service was fast and efficient. They also have a full bar, which is always good!

My boyfriend and I shared the Seafood Deluxe, basically calamari, scallops, and other seafood in coconut sauce, because we weren't exactly ferociously hungry. It was really good, not too sweet but not bland, and especially good with the rice mixed in the sauce. The thai iced tea was standard.

My friend also let me try some of her chicken wings, and they were fantastic... So good that, If I was vegetarian, I would definitely consider eating meat again.

Lalita is a great place for a large group and parties, most definitely.
author: Trista B.

description:
It was the closest Thai restaurant that was around when I was in that area. 

When we came in it was pretty quiet with BossaNova playing. The restaurant had very cute decor. Every table was set neatly. 

The drinks that we ordered: Twisted Thai Ice Tea and Blue Bombay were really served cutely; on a tall glass with some garnish on the Blue Bombay. It was kinda watered down but eh....

We ordered Angel Wings which was interesting cause we expected traditional chicken wings and got stuffed ones instead with sweet chili Thai dipping sauce. 

The Phad Thai was pretty good. It was on the expensive side but the portion made up for it. 

My girl ordered duck over rice and IT WAS HUGE. 

Overall it's a 3-star cause it was kinda expensive but only the portion made up for it. The taste was so-so.

The waitress and server were really nice though! 
She even came up and joked if the drinks were too strong cause my girl didn't drink hers yet. But that was just because she was saving it for later.
author: Miss C.

description:
Revamp of my rating system! After talking with an Elite friend, I decided to weigh the food subscore more heavily for restaurants.

Inspired by the lack of good service, I write a review.

Overall: 3/5
Just thinking about coming back is distasteful, but the food is actually quite good.

Decor: 0.5
Our party of six was seated at the backmost booth where most of the light source came from dim lamps, making it hard for me to read the menu or see the food. Otherwise the tables felt clean, and there was plenty of space.

Food: 1 x 2
I had some flat noodles with pork, basil leaves and bell peppers (and broccoli, but I'm going to pretend it doesn't exist since this vegetable is too advanced for me). Each ingredient tasted good and the dish left me feeling somewhat full. The waiter said it was "medium" spicy, but it wasn't spicy at all. Thankfully I asked for hot sauce on the side, so that helped.

Price: 0.5
My noodles were $9.95, an acceptable price when you consider the taste. The cheapest entree was $8.95. Lunch "specials" were $11.95 with extra for brown rice and whatnot. OK for San Francisco.

Service: 0
The experience disappointed me.
Strike 1 - All our dishes came separately one at a time, and our 6th person didn't even get his until we told two waiters. Was it because it was the same order as another person's? We still got charged the 18% gratuity that applies to parties of 6 or more.
Strike 2 - There was a spider crawling across the table. Nothing serious but some of us lost our appetite. We did get some tapioca and taro for dessert after, maybe as reparation?
Strike 3 - We paid our bill in credit cards and bills, expecting some change because we had too many $5s. Nope, we (I) didn't get our change. They must have been indulging in daydreams about their excellent service and helped themselves to a tip.

And just as an aside, I had a drink at the bar as well. The woman behind the counter kept snapping at me (or maybe it's the language). But still she seemed impatient with my questions (or maybe it's the culture). The vodka was also overpriced at $3 for basically a sip.
author: Brian H.

description: Surprisingly, I enjoyed my meal here.  Although, I only had the duck noodle soup, I thought it hit the spot.  The soup base was flavorful and not much msg.  The service is kinda slow but that is because she was the only waitress.  The prices are a tad higher than normal thai places and probably given the fact they are located in civic center. Btw there is happy hour mon-fri
author: Ann L.

description:
This place is conveniently located a few blocks from the Civic Center bart and seemed like a great meeting ground- my friends and I converged here to start our Weds night of adventure! Weds should be the new Fri.

Their curries and entrees were all about $14 per dish. Our group decided to shared and picked a dish from each of the their categories. The 'pad see ew' was pretty good, as was their salmon, &roasted duck. I thought the portions were a tad small for thai food though &for what we were paying. We also tried their cucumber salad, pumpkin curry, and stir-fried pork with cashews- their pork was a bit stiff and everything else was just mediocre. I also though the pumpkin curry was too sweet for me.

It does have a nice ambiance and the waitresses are all friendly. There is also a bar near the entrance where a group of hipsters were drinking and hanging about. I kinda envied them, maybe next time it would be better to just converge at the bar and skip the food.
author: Lucia C.

description: The spring rolls were huge and the sauce, perfection. The pad see ew was also delicious. Ask Winnie to make your favorite drink, or come up with one on the spot to match your mood. She will not disappoint.
author: Eric C.

description:
I have become so disappointed with this restaurant (Lowest yelp health score I've ever seen).

Do yourself a favor and avoid this place at all cost. There are too many other good restaurants in the area that will stand by their food and service. 

My story: Lalita is very close to my office so when I'm rushed for lunch with colleagues I end up here...and afterward I usually regret it. The service and quality of food is poor. Today was the final straw. I will never go back. Today I order Thai fried rice and it was terrible. It was unbelievable bland and the chicken seemed old/res-used. I had no choice but to ask for another dish. And when I did, I was told NO. This completely shocked me because I've never went to restaurant that did not stand by their food. Even fast food restaurants guarantee satisfaction. But they said NO and even made me pay for the dish. A dish that I did not eat. Note that this was the owner that I was dealing with.  After such a poor experience in service and food, I came to write this review and discovered that this restaurant has a current health score of 60/100!!! (per Yelp). That is the lowest I've ever seen. Now I feel sick because I've been eating here for years.
author: A B.

description: I simply rate it a three star for lack of sauces. Oh and my margaritas being way too strong for just a nice dinner out, They were to start the night life off. But very delicious ;)
author: Andrea K.

description:
Red curry was fine.  Pad thai- looked like they gave us leftover noodles, ordered beef with the pad thai but the dish came with only 2-3 pieces.  

Service was ludicrous.  I got the tab, paid for it and gave it to our waitress, and remain seated to continue talking to my friend.  Within seconds of retrieving the tab, a different waitress walks over to confirm the amount I wrote on the receipt, and rudely asked me if I had "forgotten" something because I didn't write anything on the tip line.  

No, I remember perfectly fine but I was going to, as I always do, put cash on the table so they have the choice to save some money.  Besides, considering that they barely served us and the waitress asking me was not the person that minimally served us, why should they take tips for granted? 

What barbaric attitude.  Won't visit again.
author: Yui S.

description:
It was last year when I stopped in for some take out. Thai food is one of my favorites and since this was across the street from my friend's loft apartment it was convenient.

Menu was a tad on the pricey side. Dim lighting, swanky looking, fancy  bar. Maybe you're paying for the ambiance.

I ordered basil fried rice and a pad thai dish. Both were delicious and were perfectly spiced.

I keep meaning to go back and try more dishes to see if the rest of the menu is as good as the dishes I tried.
author: Maxx W.

description:
This place is a great restaurant for pre theater dining. It is a short walk to either the Orpheum or the Golden Gate. Just let them know you are going to see the show and you will be out in plenty of time. 

Now the food: 
We have eaten here twice and everything is very good. I would like to make a meal of only appetizers next time as they are truly tasty. The fried calamari with sweet & sour sauce is a huge portion even for two. It is very well prepared. Not at all spicy, but great flavor. The salt & pepper beef strips with cashews and fried basil is better than the calamari. Next time I'm going for the corn fritters....

Salads: 
The spicy minced chicken salad and especially the grilled prawns w/ spicy papaya salad impressed the hell out of my wife. She had these on different occasions and is a fan. 

Entrees: 
The basil krapow w/ pork was good, but the pad kee mao w/ chicken was better. The grilled rib eye is also very good if you want something "not so Thai". 

The service is friendly and the decor is very colorful. Happy Hour on Friday nights is pretty loud due to all the students blowing off steam.... 

This is another keeper!
author: David L.

description: Been a reg for a while because of the location next to School. Amazing service and incredible food. If you want to get the "local" treatment go here winnie and vincent make everyone welcome and provide an exellent launching point for any night out A+++++++++ try the calamari and pad se yew
author: Melanie K.

description: Great lunch options.  Large portions of good food.  Best of all awesome happy Hour specials.  Draft beer, well drinks and house wine = 3.50.  A large selection of appetizers for 3.95 a piece.  And strong, delicious cocktails.  Plus a great lounge-type area to hang out with friends and enjoy the end of the day.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
GOOD FOOD + FULL BAR = Perfect after a long day at work.

We wanted to grab some food and a drink before watching Wicked, and we happened to park right in front of this restaurant (it's a block away from the Orpheum).  I tried using an iPhone to Yelp the place, but alas the 3G was too slow for me.  But we saw that it was a restaurant with a bar... so we went in anyways.

In short:
+ Pretty decent Thai food!  
+ Great portions for our appetites (we didn't even finish).
+ Easy access to the full bar.  Strong mojitos.
- Don't get a Mai Tai, it's like spiked Robitussin.

Details:
We sat at the small tables right next to the bar, and the food and drinks were served pretty fast.  The green curry and Pad Kee Mao (both with tofu and vegetables) were surprisingly good.  I might have to take my extreme hunger and low expectations into account, but everything tasted fresh and authentic.

(By the way, we were able to find parking really easily on Leavenworth RIGHT next to the restaurant.  Good place to look if you're headed to the Orpheum for an evening show.)
author: Mee-Sun Y.

description: This place is always good, their Pad-Thai is always on point and the Mango Salad is bomb.com. I have not checked them out for happy hour yet but it looks like a good spot to go before taking the train home. Great customer service and great Thai food, can't go wrong!
author: Jose T.

description:
We thought it would be a good place to have dinner after buying Rush tickets from the Orpheum. We were greeted and seated promptly at a tiny table for two. Our order took a while to appear, and they all came in gigantic plates which meant that we had to get rid of our side plates to make room on the tiny table surface.
The food was only average, and the portions smaller than the LR thai further down the road. They "ran out" of the fat noodles and substituted it without asking us if it was OK, or we wanted to order something else.
The duck curry was weak, and had very little duck.
Still, they tried their best, so I gave three stars. But unlikely to return.
author: Jan L.

description:
The food at this restaurant was okay, but the service was terrible.  Our order was taken and our food was brought to the table, but that was about it.  I had to ask twice for the bill and was given the bill for another table, the people at that table found us which was good because I don't know how long it would have taken the wait staff to sort it out.  I wanted a second drink, but the waitress never came to our table.  The people next to us waited over a half hour to get menus.
The food was average.  Ordered everything with medium spice and 2 of the 3 dishes came with very low spice.  Portion sized were good for the price.
author: Denise M.

description: Decent Food and ambience... Green Curry taste was good .. they catered to our special vegetarian needs ...  . Service was good. Worth trying out once.
author: Katty D.

description:
Two stars because they have good mojitos.
Everything else is bad - the place is dirty, too loud, the waiters are disinterested in the customers, and the food is really below average.
author: Maria J.

description:
Stopped by here with a few friends for dinner and was pleasantly surprised by the interior appearance. There was a good-sized bar at the entrance with a lively crowd, but we sat in the regular dining section next to the fountain.

The Fried Calamari in Sweet and Sour Sauce was one of the best calamari plates I've had. It was kinda like honey-walnut prawn, but without prawn and walnut (so basically crispy calamari covered in a sweet sauce). I WILL be ordering this again.

The Lemon Grass Beef was very flavorful and full of vegetables, the lemon grass being very aromatic.

The Chicken Pad See Ew was lacking in the flavor department, but it wasn't the worst I've had.

The atmosphere and food at Lalita left a good taste in my mouth, so I'll definitely be coming back to this place.
author: Stefan S.

description:
We needed a place to grab a bite to eat before a show at the Warfield.  Lalita was it. 

I was totally impressed by the fact that half of the space is a bar.  I didn't order a cocktail, but I liked that I could.

The service was a bit slow, I thought.  Our server was friendly though and that makes up for a lot.  Overall it added to the relaxed atmosphere.

Which brings me to atmosphere - babbling water fountain, low lighting and very clean - excellent bathroom.  There was a boisterous table of about 6 nearby which I liked too.  They seemed like they were ordering crazy stuff that's not on the menu.

The food was really tasty - although we only ordered two items.  In particular the fried tofu, taro root and yam app was really wonderful. 

I would definitely go here again if in the neighborhood.
author: Mac M.

description:
Red duck pineapple curry- my favorite Thai dish of all time (Pad see ew as a close second.) The one here is good, maybe not as good as Lers Ros Thai- but it's also cheap to boot! 8.95 for a rice plate. The perfect small portion for lunch time.

Their happy hour is great too- lots of Thai food like chicken satay skewers with cucumber and peanut sauce, spring rolls, fried tofu, etc. which is great for sharing.
author: Cathy S.

description:
La Lalita is just down the street from work, so I find myself here often. The food is okay, but what keeps me coming back is the waitress who serves the bar area. It's nice to have someone that remembers you and gets you to try new dishes when you come in. 

This place is also great for groups. It accommodates a lot of people and they take reservations for large parties. It's the best Thai in the area and the convenience is unbeatable. Make sure you stop by the bar for a lunch special and a nice beer.
author: Rebecca D.

description: I came here once with my friend. I really liked the elegant atmosphere. I didn't expect this place to be that authentic since it caters to the American crowd, but that's kind of weird how the short ribs reminded me of Vietnamese food. The taste is fine but I wanted a Thai taste. I don't like being overcharge for this. Maybe the other food is better but I expected better from a lunch special. They also only gave me one small piece of an eggroll... I didn't fill that full after finishing the whole plate which also included a very small salad.
author: Jennifer T.

description: After watching the Blue Angels on Oct 8th. I called my buddy who works at Banana Republic in downtown San Francisco. We decided to get some dinner since it was his hour break. We were driving around the TL and found this spot. The interior is really and elegant. I got the combo fried Rice which was really filling and good. I think I will come back here whenever I am in the city again, I want to try their cocktails.
author: Brian B.

description:
Pros -
Happy Hour Deals
very friendly staff
Good location to Orpheum Theater for pre theater drinks

Cons - 
Happy Hour food specials could have been fresher
Dark and slightly divey
author: Monica S.

description:
My buddy and I love finding gems in our work area, if for no other reason than to duck the greasy hole-in-the-walls and pushy panhandlers.

Lalita Thai R & B is a wonderful corner spot that offers a full bar, brews on tap and a lunch menu tasty yet inexpensive enough you don't have to worry about pulling out a c/c card. 

Whatever loose cash you have is enough to cover a satisfying lunch and an iced cold beer to wash it down.

Lalita has this little indoor garden -- OK, maybe it's just a few rocks and plants, but it's a nice touch, nonetheless.

The servers are nice, the bathroom is clean (enough) and the food was very authentic. 

Just don't come looking for a Lolita. Well, they have those, but it is the TL and you don't want to get yourself in trouble.
author: Phil D.

description:
Ate here with my friends on the way to the BART. First of all, I think thai food is just expensive chinese food. The atmosphere looks nice and fancy, they fold the napkins, clean looking place for the area it's in. 

I ordered the chicken pad see ew: came with chinese brocolli. The chicken was overcooked and the noodles were bland, had to add soy sauce to it. Friend got thai fried rice: fried rice with onions and chicken and egg. Really bland, chicken was definitely over cooked really hard to chew. They messed up on my other friends order, asked for roast duck soup but they just brought out regular roast duck; which they fixed. 

Service was good, friendly. Overall I wouldn't pay the price for this food.
author: Lyly T.

description: First time I ever had Thai food was here, I think. Haha.. Came here 2 years ago with my friend. It's sooo close to my school (The Art Institute of CA SF) that I graduated from. Always get the Pad See Ew & Thai Ice Tea. Friendly service.
author: Amy C.

description: My sister and I ran in to Lalita to escape the torrential downpour and I am so happy we did! It was delicious! The service was good and prices are very reasonable! When I'm back in SF we will definitely eat here again!
author: Ashley B.

description:
This review is strictly for the Happy Hour.  I must agree, that this place has a pretty good happy hour menu.  Price is $3.95 for appetizers and well drinks, draft beer, house wine $3.50.  Came here cuz a friend wanted to meet up.  It is fairly close to the Civic Center Bart Station.  

I agree with other yelpers...the price vs the portions are just not equivalent.  Been to other happy hours where the price is good and the portions are good.  Nothing we ordered really stood out in terms of taste.  

Ordered:

 Corn Fritters -- Little too fried
 Shrimp Rolls - Too small of a portion
 Grilled & Fried Calamari - Fried was a little too sweet, grilled was just ok
 Silver Noodle Salad - way too salty
 Fish Balls - Nothing too special.  Can make this at home
 Chicken Sate - portion was ridiculous
 Half a grilled Chicken - moist, but a little too sweet
 Spicy Raw Shrimp (A.K.A Naked Shrimp at some Thai Places) -- shrimp was def. not fresh
 Fried Fish Cakes - little too overcooked and small portion

Food was mediocore.  The only reason I gave this place 3 stars was because of the Lychee Martini. This was the only thing that stood out the whole night.  Considering the location that it's in with the small portions of food, I really doubt I would return.
author: Doraemon T.

description: This place used to be a 5. Don't get me wrong.  The food is still excellent.  The service has declined.  You have to constantly flag down waitstaff to get any service. It's ridiculous, and they actually charged for a refill.  Come on.  I used to work in restaurant management.  That refill costs pennies, literally. This was tacky, and they didn't even inform me that they were charging me until the bill came.
author: dAvid s.

description: One of my go-to restaurants when I want to indulge in between classes. I usually order off of their dinner menu because they have healthier options such as fresh spring rolls and salads. Their bar drinks are pretty delicious as well, their mango margarita is one of my favorites :)
author: Eleanor E.

description: Me and my friends go here at the end of our school work weeks to relax for a few hours and enjoy a few beers and our good company.  The waiters/owners/bartenders all are super friendly and treat their customers great!  Great food as well, especially the appetizers but my favorite dinner dish there is Krapow Chicken with Rice its a little spicy which basil also. Try this spot out if your ever in the "Civc Center" Area!
author: Kelsey B.

description: My grilled duck was tasty. Tasty like, it tasted flame grilled. Flame grilled as in, like Burger King. What I mean to say is that I was eating "duck" and thought the whole time it was actually a whopper from BK.
author: Emily D.

description:
Surprisingly good for a random thai restaurant in the middle of the Tenderloin!  We came in for an early dinner on Saturday.  

The portions were all large and perfect for sharing.  We ordered spring rolls, taro/tofu fries (YUM), tofu pad kee mao, eggplant with green beans, choo chee salmon, and tofu curry with peanut sauce.  Everything was really good - yummy sauces and tons of veggies.

The desserts and drinks were highlights too.  The crazy thai coffee was super refreshing and fabulous.  I got the samui melon which was totally NEON green and tasty.  The coconut ice cream, fried bananas with honey, and sticky rice with mango were AWESOME.  

Good find in the neighborhood!
author: Laura B.

description:
I've tried a lot of Thai Restaurants and I must say, this is the best that I had.

Yelped this place because it was near the Orpheum Theatre. Yes, my friends and I were on our way to watch Wicked (go watch it if you haven't). Despite Lalita's shady location, this place is amazing.

We only had 40 minutes to order, eat, and get to the theatre so we asked our waitress if she can hurry our orders, and hurry she did. Wow, all 8 of us had our dishes within 5-10 minutes after we ordered! And our serving portions were soooo huge, which complemented well with the price. 

If I'm ever back in that area again, I'll definitely stop by!
author: Sujin H.

description:
I am the 100th person to review Lalita.  Why do I feel entitled to some sort of prize.  Maybe Yelp should also have flair for 100th review like they do for 1st to review.  I would wear said prize with the biggest stupid grin you ever did see.  Shameless self-entitlement aside, let us review some Lalita!

Compared to the mass volume of people who traverse the Civic Center area everyday, there sure aren't many places to eat.  The first thing that attracted me to Lalita was the storefront window seating that was covered with pillows.  I took my girlfriend there the night I saw that and made sure she sat in that place (score +1 for the boyfriend).  In the back of the bar, there is another pillow-filled lounge area that looks like it would be a great deal of fun if you were to have a group of 4 or more drunken friends.  With the kitchy-but-classy decor, the neon-lit bar, and the wait staff who are 100% friendly yet 100% business, I can't resist being thrown into a blissful state of reminiscence of the week I spent in Bangkok a few summers ago.  It must be the nostalgia that keeps me coming back to Lalita.  The edibles and drinkables keep me coming back as well!

Their fried noodles are the best.  I always get the Pad Kee Mao with beef or the Pad Thai.  The seasonings they use on the meat are very tasty.  The portions are also rather impressive.  I usually just eat a few noodles and then pick the goodies out.  I would like it if there were more veggies in said goodies.  If you like fried things, the appetizer menu has plenty of that.  Whatever you order, you're not very likely to be disappointed.

Complimentary tapioca pudding (w/ taro root) is served when they bring your check.  The pudding is good, but I usually opt to not eat the taro.

I really like the way they make fun drinks.  If you look at the menu, there's not a whole lot of mysteriously-named libations, but all your familiar go-and-get-trashed-while-you're-on-vacation kind of drinks (the PG-13 menu simply lists the 'Adios Motherf***er' as just an 'Adios').  The Twisted Thai Tea (Thai Tea with vanilla vodka) is probably my fave.  With festive containers and fun garnishes, you'll get your swerve on in style.  When we came here to eat the day before the pride festival last year, they had about 10 people lined up along the bar preparing $2 jello shots for the ensuing madness.  The only thing I thought was "there's no way in Hades you guys are going to be able to make enough jello shots."
